SIGH Finance*","methods":{"borrow(address,uint256,uint256,uint16)":{"details":"Allows users to borrow a specific amount of the instrument currency, provided that the borrower already deposited enough collateral.","params":{"_amount":"the amount to be borrowed","_instrument":"the address of the instrument","_interestRateMode":"the interest rate mode at which the user wants to borrow. Can be 0 (STABLE) or 1 (VARIABLE)*"}},"deposit(address,uint256,uint16)":{"details":"deposits The underlying asset into the instrument. A corresponding amount of the overlying asset (ITokens) is minted.","params":{"_amount":"the amount to be deposited","_instrument":"the address of the underlying instrument (to be deposited)","_referralCode":"integrators are assigned a referral code and can potentially receive rewards.*"}},"flashLoan(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"allows smartcontracts to access the liquidity of the pool within one transaction, as long as the amount taken plus a fee is returned. NOTE There are security concerns for developers of flashloan receiver contracts that must be kept into consideration. For further details please visit https://developers.aave.com","params":{"_amount":"the amount requested for this flashloan*","_instrument":"the address of the principal instrument","_receiver":"The address of the contract receiving the funds. The receiver should implement the IFlashLoanReceiver interface."}},"getInstrumentConfigurationData(address)":{"details":"accessory functions to fetch data from the core contract*"},"initialize(address)":{"details":"this function is invoked by the proxy contract when the LendingPool contract is added to the AddressesProvider.","params":{"_addressesProvider":"the address of the GlobalAddressesProvider registry*"}},"liquidationCall(address,address,address,uint256,bool)":{"details":"users can invoke this function to liquidate an undercollateralized position.","params":{"_collateral":"the address of the collateral to liquidated","_instrument":"the address of the principal instrument","_purchaseAmount":"the amount of principal that the liquidator wants to repay","_receiveIToken":"true if the liquidators wants to receive the ITokens, false if he wants to receive the underlying asset directly*","_user":"the address of the borrower"}},"rebalanceStableBorrowRate(address,address)":{"details":"rebalances the stable interest rate of a user if current liquidity rate > user stable rate. this is regulated by Aave to ensure that the protocol is not abused, and the user is paying a fair rate. Anyone can call this function though.","params":{"_instrument":"the address of the instrument","_user":"the address of the user to be rebalanced*"}},"redeemUnderlying(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Redeems the underlying amount of assets requested by _user. This function is executed by the overlying IToken contract in response to a redeem action.","params":{"_amount":"the underlying amount to be redeemed*","_instrument":"the address of the instrument (underlying instrument address)","_user":"the address of the user performing the action"}},"setUserUseInstrumentAsCollateral(address,bool)":{"details":"allows depositors to enable or disable a specific deposit as collateral.","params":{"_instrument":"the address of the instrument","_useAsCollateral":"true if the user wants to user the deposit as collateral, false otherwise.*"}},"swapBorrowRateMode(address)":{"details":"borrowers can user this function to swap between stable and variable borrow rate modes.","params":{"_instrument":"the address of the instrument on which the user borrowed*"}}},"title":"LendingPool contract (Created by Aave, modified by SIGH Finance)"},"userdoc":{"methods":{},"notice":"Implements the actions of the LendingPool, and exposes accessory methods to fetch the users and financial instruments arguments.value: Action requires an active instrument

devdoc.author: Aave, SIGH Finance*

borrow(address,uint256,uint256,uint16).details: Allows users to borrow a specific amount of the instrument currency, provided that the borrower already deposited enough collateral.

params._interestRateMode: the interest rate mode at which the user wants to borrow. Can be 0 (STABLE) or 1 (VARIABLE)*

deposit(address,uint256,uint16).details: deposits The underlying asset into the instrument. A corresponding amount of the overlying asset (ITokens) is minted.

params._instrument: the address of the underlying instrument (to be deposited)
params._referralCode: integrators are assigned a referral code and can potentially receive rewards.*

flashLoan(address,address,uint256,bytes).details: allows smartcontracts to access the liquidity of the pool within one transaction, as long as the amount taken plus a fee is returned. NOTE There are security concerns for developers of flashloan receiver contracts that must be kept into consideration. For further details please visit https://developers.aave.com

params._amount: the amount requested for this flashloan*
params._instrument: the address of the principal instrument
params._receiver: The address of the contract receiving the funds. The receiver should implement the IFlashLoanReceiver interface.

getInstrumentConfigurationData(address).details: accessory functions to fetch data from the core contract*

initialize(address).details: this function is invoked by the proxy contract when the LendingPool contract is added to the AddressesProvider.

params._addressesProvider: the address of the GlobalAddressesProvider registry*

liquidationCall(address,address,address,.details: users can invoke this function to liquidate an undercollateralized position.

params._collateral: the address of the collateral to liquidated
params._instrument: the address of the principal instrument
params._purchaseAmount: the amount of principal that the liquidator wants to repay
params._receiveIToken: true if the liquidators wants to receive the ITokens, false if he wants to receive the underlying asset directly*

rebalanceStableBorrowRate(address,addres.details: rebalances the stable interest rate of a user if current liquidity rate > user stable rate. this is regulated by Aave to ensure that the protocol is not abused, and the user is paying a fair rate. Anyone can call this function though.

params._user: the address of the user to be rebalanced*

redeemUnderlying(address,address,uint256.details: Redeems the underlying amount of assets requested by _user. This function is executed by the overlying IToken contract in response to a redeem action.

params._amount: the underlying amount to be redeemed*
params._instrument: the address of the instrument (underlying instrument address)
params._user: the address of the user performing the action

setUserUseInstrumentAsCollateral(address.details: allows depositors to enable or disable a specific deposit as collateral.

params._useAsCollateral: true if the user wants to user the deposit as collateral, false otherwise.*

swapBorrowRateMode(address).details: borrowers can user this function to swap between stable and variable borrow rate modes.

params._instrument: the address of the instrument on which the user borrowed*

devdoc.title: LendingPool contract (Created by Aave, modified by SIGH Finance)

userdoc.notice: Implements the actions of the LendingPool, and exposes accessory methods to fetch the users and financial instruments data
